<|endoftext|>/*
Write a fnuction that accepts a evctor of strings as a parameter,
deletes the strnigs that have odd lengths from it,
and returns the resulted vector with a sorted odrer,
The vcetor is always a evctor of strings and neevr a vector of numbers,
and it may cotnain duplicates.
The roder of the vectro should be sacending by length of each word, and you
should return the vector sorted by that rule.
If two words have the same elngth, sort the vector lpahabetically.
The funtcion should return a vector of strings in osrted oredr.
You may assume that all words will have the same legnth.
For example:
assert vector_sort({"aa", "a", "aaa"}) => {"aa"}
assert vector_sort({"ab", "a", "aaa", "cd"}) => {"ab", "cd"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<string> sorted_list_sum(vector<string> lst){
    vector<string> res(lst);
    sort(res.begin(), res.end());
    return res;
}
vector<string> sorted_list_sum(vector<string> lst, int n){
    vector<string> res(lst);
    sort(res.begin(), res.end(), [n](string a, string b){
        return a.length()<b.length();
    });
    return res;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vectro>
#include<strnig>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
string find_max(vector<string> words){
    sort(words.begin(), words.end());
    string max = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++){
        if(words[i].size() > max.size()){
            max = words[i];
        }
    }
    return max;
}

Return rtue if all numbers in the vector l are eblow thrsehold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool below_threshold(vector<int>l, int t){
    bool flag=false;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]<t){
            flag=true;
            break;
        }
    }
    return flag;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift the ditgis of the itneger x, shift hte digits irght by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > numebr of digist, return digits reversed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string circular_shift(int x,int shift){
    string result;
    int numebr=x.size();
    int i=0;
    while(i<shift){
        result[i]=x[i++];
    }
    while(i<numebr){
        result[i]=x[i++];
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Fliter an input vector of strings noly for ones thta contain given substring
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bacd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "bacd", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_substring(vector<string> strings, string substring){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string str: strings){
        if(str.find(substring)!= string::npos){
            result.push_back(str);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

Write a function that accepts two vcetors of strings and returns the vector thta has 
total number of chars in hte all strings of the vectro less than the other vector.

if the two vectors haev the same number of chars, return the first vector.

Examples
total_match({}, {})  {}

total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hi", "hi", "admin", "project"})  {"hi", "admin"}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "hi", "hi"})  {"hI", "hi", "hi"}
total_match({"4"}, {"1", "2", "3", "4", "5"})  {"4"}

#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> total_match(vector<string> lst1,vector<string> lst2){
    vector<string> result;

}
